Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • swordandshield.models.Piece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a piece that can be located at any position on the board Created by Chris on 1/08/2017.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(Round round,
                 java.lang.String dir)
        Handles the shifting of a piece around the board. It destroys the piece by setting the position on the grid equal to null. It then sets it's position to 1 square offset away from the previous position in the direction specified by the parameter
        Parameters:
        dir - direction of offset move. move(east) moves it one square east

      • rotatePieceCW

        public void rotatePieceCW(int times)
        Rotates a piece 90 degrees every time for the parameter times
        Parameters:
        times - number of times to rotate by 90 degrees

      • detAdjacentPieceLength

        public int detAdjacentPieceLength(Round round,
                                  Coord currPos,
                                  java.lang.String dir,
                                  int num)
        Given a piece, a direction to look and its current position it recursively finds how many pieces are adjacent to it in that direction. If there is nothing to the east when dir = east, then it would return 0.
        Parameters:
        round - round reference
        currPos - position of piece we're looking at (changes every recursive call by 1 in the direction of dir)
        dir - direction to find adjacent pieces
        num - the number of adjacent pieces, this is returned
        Returns:
        We return num (see parameter). 0 is returned if there is no pieces next to the piece this was called on
